alert.note: Alert for Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 6:10PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wilson and Woodson Counties through 645 PM CST... At 609 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Toronto to 5 miles northwest of Elk City. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fredonia, Yates Center, Altoona, Toronto, Buffalo, Neosho Falls, Benedict, New Albany, Coyville, Buxton, Toronto Lake, Batesville, Rose and Cross Timbers State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for southeastern Kansas.
